data.database_description: The database is designed to manage and track documents within an organization, detailing their types, storage locations, associated roles, and lifecycle events including destruction. It includes tables for document types, calendar dates for time tracking, various storage locations, employee roles, and specific document records with attributes such as names and descriptions. The relationships between tables are established through foreign keys that connect documents to their types, the employees managing them, and their physical or planned virtual locations over time. Additionally, it tracks documents scheduled for destruction, linking these actions to responsible employees and relevant calendar dates, ensuring a comprehensive audit trail of document handling processes within the organization.

columns.columnDescription: Unique code identifying each document type.
Name assigned to the document type for easy reference.
Detailed description of what the document type encompasses.

enriched_schema.tableDescription: Defines various types of documents, including their codes and descriptions.

columns.columnDescription: Records specific datetime instances, serving as a primary key to uniquely identify each date entry.
Indicates the day of the week (e.g., 1 for Monday, 7 for Sunday) corresponding to each calendar date entry.

enriched_schema.tableDescription: Tracks calendar dates and corresponding day numbers for time-related tracking within the organization.

columns.columnDescription: Unique code identifying each storage location, used as a primary key.
Human-readable name of the location for identification purposes.
Additional descriptive information about the location to provide context or details not covered by the name.

enriched_schema.tableDescription: Contains reference data for all possible storage locations of documents.

columns.columnDescription: Unique code representing a specific role within the organization.
Descriptive name of the role.
Detailed explanation or description of the responsibilities and duties associated with the role.

sample_data: ED, Manager, Vero harum corrupti odit ipsa vero et odio. Iste et recusandae temporibus maxime. Magni aspernatur fugit quis explicabo totam esse corrupti.
HR, Editor, Itaque dolor ut nemo rerum vitae provident. Vel laborum ipsum velit sint. Et est omnis dignissimos.
MG, Photo, Aut modi nihil molestias temporibus sit rerum. Sit neque eaque odio omnis incidunt.
enriched_schema.tableDescription: Defines various roles within the organization, including a description for each role.

columns.columnDescription: Unique identifier for each document.
Timestamp indicating when the document was stored.
Code representing the type of document, linked to Ref_Document_Types table.
Name or title of the document.
Brief description providing details about the content of the document.
Additional information related to the document that doesn't fit into other fields.

sample_data: 25, 2008-06-08 12:45:38, PR, One hundred years of solitude
enriched_schema.tableDescription: Stores details of documents within an organization, tracking their types, storage dates, names, descriptions, and other relevant information.

columns.columnDescription: Unique identifier for each employee.
Code representing the role assigned to the employee, linking to the Roles table.
Full name of the employee.
Optional field for gender identification (Male, Female, Unspecified).
Employee's date and time of birth.
Additional information or notes about the employee.

enriched_schema.tableDescription: Stores details of employees within the organization, including their roles and personal information.

columns.columnDescription: Unique identifier for each document, linking to specific records in the All_Documents table.
Code representing the physical or virtual location where a document is stored, linked to Ref_Locations.
Start date and time marking when a document was moved into a specific location, validated against Ref_Calendar dates.
End date and time indicating when a document left the specified location or is expected to leave, also validated against Ref_Calendar dates.

enriched_schema.tableDescription: Tracks the historical and current locations of documents over time.

columns.columnDescription: Unique identifier of the document scheduled for destruction.
Identifier of the employee who authorized the destruction of the document.
Identifier of the employee who physically destroyed the document.
Scheduled date and time for the document's destruction.
Date and time when the document was actually destroyed.
Additional information related to the document's destruction process.

enriched_schema.tableDescription: Tracks documents that are scheduled for destruction, including authorization and execution details.
